poem:
Title: Confluence

An alliance marries two nations,
Dublin pledges to Madrid's ovation.
In silence, whispering recognition,
Of Palestine's latent position.

Young dawn-light breathes on prospective states,
As Taoiseach to Prime Minister relates.
In the echo of this dusty tale,
A hope in Sánchez's words prevail.

Two-state solution, fervently sought,
In Dublin's courts, the idea is caught.
Cordial tones resound, and stand,
For the quiet emergence of a promised land.
